result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorena Irene Ordonez

records.addlTxt:
Motion Hearing exhibits from 10/06/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 793

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Lorena Irene Ordonez.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for continued motion hearing on Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence. Continued Motion hearing proceeded with cross-examination. Sworn for state: P.O. Justin Jackett.
Testimony closed. Closing arguments. 
Based on statements put forth by Court and parties, Court DENIED Defense motion. Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 11. 
Defense counsel and defendant is allowed to appear by zoom.
Status conference scheduled for February 16, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 11 pages) commencing 05-19-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court.  Attorney Michael M. Hayes in court for Lorena Irene Ordonez.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing on Defense Motion to Suppress Evidence.  Arguments placed on the record.  Motion hearing proceeded. Sworn for state: P.O. Justin Jackett. Exhibits 1 and 2 received. 
State rest. Court adjourns matter for a continued motion hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress, filed.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress all Evidence Seized After Illegal Stop of Defendant's Vehicle and After Illegal Arrest of Defendant, filed.

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense not prepared to proceed with plea and sentencing and requested motion hearing date.  Defense to file any motions by September 1, 2022.  State to file motion response by September 30, 2022.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense to receive blood test results.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Attorney Hayes has provided defendant with the next court date.

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes appear in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Officer J.Jackett.  Stipulation to the drug testing agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 040481,
Payable Number: 1002252,
Receipt Number: 22RP016860,
Amount: $20.00
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in court with attorney Michael A. Hayes.  Defendant Lorena Irene Ordonez in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lorena Irene Ordonez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
